entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 23 at 8:36PM EDT until October 26 at 2:00PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The Saint Johns River near Astor is forecast to continue falling through Minor Flood Stage through midweek. The river is forecast to fall near to below Minor Flood late this week.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 3:11AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH FIRE DANGER CONDITIONS THIS AFTERNOON FOR NORTHWEST GEORGIA DUE TO LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITIES... Relative Humidities of 25 percent or less can be expected for 4 or more hours this afternoon. Winds will be east to southeast at up to 10 mph with gusts up to 15 mph. With dry fuels, high fire danger conditions can be expected.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Bartow; Catoosa; Chattooga; Dade; Fannin; Floyd; Gilmer; Gordon; Murray; Pickens; Polk; Walker; Whitfield

A robust and cold weather system will deliver mountain snow, lowland rain-snow, and colder overnight temperatures lingering through the remainder of
entry.cap:areaDesc: Okanogan Highlands

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 5:38AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT BROWN...KEWAUNEE...SOUTHERN DOOR...NORTHEASTERN CALUMET AND NORTHERN MANITOWOC COUNTIES THROUGH 615 AM CDT... At 537 AM CDT, trained weather spotters reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Green Bay to near Brillion. Movement was east at 45 mph.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Brown; Calumet; Door; Kewaunee; Manitowoc

entry.title: Frost Advisory issued October 24 at 3:58AM EDT until October 24 at 10:00AM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FROST ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Temperatures as low as 33 will result in frost formation. * WHERE...Portions of Maryland, The District of Columbia, central and northern Virginia and eastern West Virginia.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Berkeley; Eastern Mineral; Hampshire; Jefferson; Morgan

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 24 at 4:48AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...PATCHY DENSE FOG THIS MORNING... Watch out for patchy dense fog this morning. The lowest visibilities are expected in and near the Black Hills. Motorists should expect rapidly changing visibility, down to near zero at times. Remember to use your low beam headlights in fog, slow down, and provide plenty of braking distance between yourself
entry.cap:areaDesc: Newcastle; Northeastern Crook; Western Crook; Weston County Plains; Wyoming Black Hills

entry.title: Winter Storm Warning issued October 24 at 1:48AM MDT until October 26 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM WEDNESDAY TO 6 PM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 12 inches for elevations above 7000 feet and 12 to 24 inches for elevations above 8000 feet. Isolated areas with higher amounts are possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Absaroka Mountains; Teton and Gros Ventre Mountains; Yellowstone National Park
